# Contributing to twist3dink.xyz

I just want to say **thank you** for wanting to add to my first project! Any and all of your **contributions, big or small**, are very much valued! I look forward to learning, growing with you all, and being part of something bigger than myself.

> **Security that is enforced doesn't feel heroic, but if you stay ready, so you never have to get ready.**

## How to Contribute
1. **Fork the repo** and clone your fork locally.
2. **Create a feature branch**: `git checkout -b feature/your-idea`.
3. **Make your changes** and commit with clear messages: `git commit -m "Add [description]"`.
4. **Push your branch**: `git push origin feature/your-idea`.
5. **Open a Pull Request** (PR) here on GitHub—reference any related issues.

## Validation Requirements Before Submitting
All contributions must meet these to merge smoothly (stay ready!):

1. **CI Checks**: All PRs must pass automated CI checks.
2. **`innerHTML` Usage**: Triggers **force review**—grep it (`grep -n innerHTML src/`) and explain in your PR.
3. **Run Validators**:
   - [W3C HTML Validator](https://validator.w3.org/) (upload file/URL for markup fixes).
   - [W3C CSS Validator](https://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/).
   - [JSHint](https://jshint.com/) for JS code quality.
4. **Follow the Code of Conduct**: Be respectful—see [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/twist3dink/twist3dink.xyz/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
5. **Keep It Tight**: Contributions should be **concise, focused, and well-documented**.

## Questions or Ideas?
Open an issue using templates from [`/academy/flipper-zero/templates`](https://github.com/twist3dink/twist3dink.xyz/tree/main/academy/flipper-zero/templates) (or root `/templates`). Let's hack ethically and learn together—what's your "why"?

Happy hacking!
